channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 3 Are Arrested in Russia-Linked Sabotage Plot, Germany Says
item.description: The men, Ukrainian nationals, were arrested in Germany and Switzerland, the state prosecutor in Berlin said. They are suspected of planning to sabotag...

item.title: Taking Inches in Battle, Russia Demands Miles in Talks
item.description: Moscow thinks it’s winning in Ukraine and can play hardball diplomatically. Washington sees costly, incremental gains and an unrealistic negotiating p...

item.title: RFK Jr. is about to get grilled by the Senate health committee for the first time since he was confirmed
item.description: Ranking member of the Senate health committee Bill Cassidy said he was alarmed by Kennedy's history of promoting conspiracy theories.

item.title: Bidding war sends rare ‘Mediterranean Blue’ diamond to $21.5 million at Sotheby’s auction, but not everyone’s dazzled
item.description: A rare 10.3-carat blue diamond sold for $21.5 million after fierce bidding—but some experts say global uncertainty dimmed the auction’s full potential...

item.title: Court Sides With New York Times Over Access to E.U. Covid Vaccine Messages
item.description: The case revolved around whether texts between a top official and a drug company executive counted as a public record that might need to be disclosed.

item.title: HBO’s Streaming Service Becomes ‘HBO Max’ Again
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery executives are reinstating the name HBO Max for the popular streaming service. It’s the fourth name change for the app in the l...

item.title: Militant’s Death Would Be Blow to Hamas, but May Have Limited Long-Term Consequences
item.description: Israel tried to kill Muhammad Sinwar, a key Hamas leader in Gaza. If confirmed, his death would deprive the group of another top commander, but it mig...

item.title: ESPN’s streaming service will cost $30 per month. Here’s how that ranks against other streaming services
item.description: It's getting harder and harder to argue streaming's value vs. cable.

item.title: New poll says Democrats are deeply pessimistic about the future of their party: ‘I just feel like the majority of the old Democratic Party needs to go’
item.description: “They’re not in tune with the new generation," said Monica Brown, a Democrat from Tennessee. "We’ve got such division within the party.”

item.title: Squaring the accounts of Kevin Warsh, whom Trump could pick as Fed chairman next year
item.description: A recent speech offered clues into how Warsh might lead the central bank he’s criticized. Not everything added up.

item.title: Map: 6.0-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Crete, Prompting a Tsunami Alert
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Lands in Qatar After Meeting Militant Who Now Leads Syria
item.description: President Trump’s meeting with President Ahmed al-Shara came after he said he would lift U.S. sanctions on Syria. Mr. Trump’s Gulf tour has mostly sid...

item.title: Court Sides With New York Times Over Access to E.U. Covid Vaccine Messages
item.description: The case revolved around whether texts between a top official and a drug company executive counted as a public record that might need to be disclosed.

item.title: Pepe Mujica, the Former Uruguayan President, Removed the Pomp from Politics
item.description: The former Uruguayan president, who died on Tuesday, showed the value in world leaders living like their constituents.

item.title: Trump Administration to Weaken Some Limits on PFAS in Drinking Water
item.description: The E.P.A. said it would maintain limits on the two most common PFAS chemicals found in tap water but roll back rules for four others.
